entry.title: Refinement of Pair Distribution Functions with DISCUC
entry.summary: DISCUS is a comprehensive program for generating disordered atomic structures and computing experimental data like single crystal diffuse scattering and atomic pair distribution functions (PDF). It features symmetry operations, Monte Carlo simulations, and domain structure generation.

entry.title: Refinement of Pair Distribution Functions with RMCProfile
entry.summary: The Reverse Monte Carlo (RMC) method provides a unique perspective on atomic structure, derived directly from experimental data. It is primarily used to analyze neutron and x-ray total scattering data and is particularly effective for studying disordered materials, where other methods offer limited information.

entry.title: Refinement of Pair Distribution Functions with PDFgui
entry.summary: PDFgui provides a user-friendly interface for the PDFfit2 refinement program, enabling full-profile fitting of atomic pair distribution functions (PDF) from x-ray or neutron diffraction data.

entry.title: Use Dioptas for Efficient 2D Powder Diffraction Data Reduction
entry.summary: Dioptas is an awesome GUI program based on Python, designed for the fast data reduction of Powder X-ray Diffraction images. It provides the capability of calibrating, integrating, creating masks, showing multiple pattern overlays and display phases line positions.
